components.name: userTask
components.description: A task that requires human intervention. Users interact with 'user tasks' via a task management system named eTask.
components.usage: Use this task type when a task in the process flow requires manual action by a user. It typically involves human interaction, such as reviewing a document, approving a request, or entering data.

requiredInputs.name: taskName
requiredInputs.description: Name of the eTask for identification and display purposes

requiredInputs.name: taskDescription
requiredInputs.description: Detailed description of what the user needs to do in this task

requiredInputs.name: taskTypeName
requiredInputs.description: Identifier for the type of task being created in the eTask system

requiredInputs.name: sourceSystemName
requiredInputs.description: Source system or process that generated this task

requiredInputs.name: taskPriority
requiredInputs.description: Priority level of the task.

requiredInputs.name: taskDeadline
requiredInputs.description: Expected completion date and time for the task in date format (e.g. YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SS) or  duration (e.g. P{days}DT{hours}H{minutes}M)

requiredInputs.name: routingStrategy
requiredInputs.description: Strategy for routing the task to appropriate users or groups

requiredInputs.name: maximumActiveTasks
requiredInputs.description: Maximum number of active user tasks allowed before throttling

generatedOutputs.name: reasonCode
generatedOutputs.description: Reason code indicating how the task was completed. Useful for determining approval outcomes (e.g., 'APPROVED' vs 'REJECTED') or other completion reasons.

generatedOutputs.name: comment
generatedOutputs.description: The comment entered by the user who completed the task.

generatedOutputs.name: completionPayload
generatedOutputs.description: Optional payload data containing additional information submitted when the task was completed. Use this to access custom data or form fields submitted by the user

generatedOutputs.name: taskIdentifier
generatedOutputs.description: Unique reference identifier from taskCompletionPayload for the completed task instance. Useful for tracking, auditing, or correlating this specific task execution with external systems

components.name: serviceTask
components.description: A task performed by an external software service. Typically a REST call to GET/PUT/POST/DELETE
components.usage: Use service tasks when a task in the process flow can be automated and executed by a software service or application without direct human involvement. It often involves invoking external systems, performing calculations, or executing predefined functions

requiredInputs.name: location
requiredInputs.description: Identification for the target service, e.g a hardcoded URL or GS Discover path in example format /{domain}/.../{service}/location or variable containing such a value

requiredInputs.name: uriPath
requiredInputs.description: Specific URI path to append to the location identifier

requiredInputs.name: httpMethod
requiredInputs.description: HTTP Method of the request to be invoked on the REST service called by this task

requiredInputs.name: headers
requiredInputs.description: HTTP headers to include in the request. It's a stringified map where keys are header names and values are the corresponding header values

requiredInputs.name: queryParams
requiredInputs.description: Query parameters for the request URL. It's a stringified map where keys are parameter names and values are the corresponding parameter values

requiredInputs.name: inputExpression
requiredInputs.description: Provide an expression or a Groovy script to be used to resolve the body of the HTTP request. Not required for GET requests

requiredInputs.name: outputScript
requiredInputs.description: Groovy script to process the response from the server (e.g handle status code and throw exceptions). The response object will be available in a `response` variable

generatedOutputs.name: statusCode
generatedOutputs.description: HTTP status code returned by the service

components.name: scriptTask
components.description: A task that is performed based on scripted logic within the process.
components.usage: Use script tasks when a task in the process flow requires custom logic or algorithmic processing. It is suitable when the logic can be localized within the process (i.e. does not require external data or systems, which is where a service task is more appropriate). It allows you to define Groovy script scripts to perform specific actions or calculations within the process.

requiredInputs.name: script
requiredInputs.description: Groovy script code to execute

generatedOutputs.name: result
generatedOutputs.description: Name of the variable that stores the output of the script execution

components.name: businessRuleTask
components.description: A task that executes a business rule or decision logic.
components.usage: Use business rule tasks when a task in the process flow involves executing business rules or decision logic. It allows you to define and execute business rules or decision tables to determine the flow of the process based on certain conditions or criteria.

requiredInputs.name: executionEngine
requiredInputs.description: Execution engine for rule evaluation.

requiredInputs.name: applicationId
requiredInputs.description: ID of the Application within Decision Services Platform

requiredInputs.name: ruleName
requiredInputs.description: Rule Name of the rule to be executed in Decision Services Platform

requiredInputs.name: ruleVersion
requiredInputs.description: Rule Version of the rule to be executed in Decision Services Platform

components.name: sendTask
components.description: A task that sends a message or signal to another process participant.
components.usage: Use send tasks when a task in the process flow involves sending a message or signal to another process participant or external system. It initiates communication or triggers actions in other parts of the process or external systems.

requiredInputs.name: location
requiredInputs.description: Identification for the target service

requiredInputs.name: httpPath
requiredInputs.description: Specific URI path to append to the location identifier

requiredInputs.name: httpMethod
requiredInputs.description: HTTP Method of the request to be invoked on the REST service called by this task

requiredInputs.name: headers
requiredInputs.description: HTTP headers to include in the request. It's a stringified map where keys are header names and values are the corresponding header values

requiredInputs.name: queryParams
requiredInputs.description: Query parameters for the request URL. It's a stringified map where keys are parameter names and values are the corresponding parameter values

requiredInputs.name: inputExpression
requiredInputs.description: Provide an expression or a Groovy script to be used to resolve the body of the HTTP request. Not required for GET requests

requiredInputs.name: outputScript
requiredInputs.description: Groovy script to process the response from the server (e.g handle status code and throw exceptions). The response object will be available as a `response` variable

components.name: receiveTask
components.description: A task that waits to receive a message or signal from another process participant.
components.usage: Use receive tasks when a task in the process flow waits to receive a message or signal from another process participant or external system. It typically represents a waiting state until the expected message or signal is received.

requiredInputs.name: messageId
requiredInputs.description: ID of a message to listen for

requiredInputs.name: availabilityRuleScript
requiredInputs.description: A Groovy script that specifies control of who can call this Receive Task

components.name: startEvent
components.description: Represents the beginning of a process flow.
components.usage: Place at the start of the process flow to indicate where it begins. Can have triggers like message, timer, or signal.  Only one per process

components.name: endEvent
components.description: Denotes the completion of a process flow.
components.usage: Place at the end of the process flow to indicate where it ends. Can have outcomes like message, error, or termination. At least one required per process

components.name: exclusiveGateway
components.description: Allows branching based on a condition
components.usage: Use when the process flow can branch to multiple nodes, but ONLY ONE of the paths can be followed. Each outgoing connection flow has a condition which must be met for the process to take that path

requiredInputs.name: default
requiredInputs.description: Identifier of a default target node if no conditions are met.

requiredInputs.name: conditions
requiredInputs.description: Data used for condition evaluation. It's a stringified map where keys are target node identifiers and values are the corresponding conditions

components.name: inclusiveGateway
components.description: Allows branching based on a condition
components.usage: Use when the process flow can branch to multiple nodes, and MULTIPLE paths can be followed simultaneously. Each outgoing connection flow has a condition which must be met for the process to take that path.

requiredInputs.name: default
requiredInputs.description: Identifier of a default target node if no conditions are met

requiredInputs.name: conditions
requiredInputs.description: Data used for condition evaluation. It's a stringified map where keys are target node identifiers and values are the corresponding conditions

components.name: parallelGateway
components.description: Allows diverging into, or converging from, multiple parallel paths.
components.usage: Use when the process flow should split into multiple parallel paths or merge from multiple parallel paths simultaneously. All outgoing sequence flows are followed in parallel, and all incoming sequence flows must complete before proceeding
